meanings.definition: (verb) to be situated on each side of or on one side of (someone or something)
meanings.sent1: The trees were flanking the path, creating a beautiful natural tunnel.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers were flanking the enemy, ready to attack from both sides.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels were flanking the picnic area, hoping for some tasty crumbs.
meanings.sent4: The mountains flanking the valley seemed to protect it like giant guardians.
meanings.sent5: The colorful flowers flanking the entrance made it look welcoming and cheerful.

meanings.definition: (adjective) positioned on the side of something or someone
meanings.sent1: The flanking chairs provided extra seating for the guests.
meanings.sent2: The flanking walls were adorned with beautiful paintings.
meanings.sent3: The flanking trees cast a cool shadow over the garden.
meanings.sent4: The flanking buildings gave the street a cozy, enclosed feel.
meanings.sent5: The flanking statues added a touch of elegance to the courtyard.

meanings.definition: (noun) the act of positioning oneself on the side of someone or something
meanings.sent1: The flanking of the team members showed great teamwork and strategy.
meanings.sent2: The flanking of the students in the debate made their argument stronger.
meanings.sent3: The flanking of the dancers on stage added depth to the performance.
meanings.sent4: The flanking of the cars in the parking lot caused a traffic jam.
meanings.sent5: The flanking of the trees along the riverbank created a peaceful atmosphere.
